A9C2F053A3DE4604BE86A83F14F3FC30.description: Develop and/or revise personal and career goals based on the work placement experience.

BA655B376C7040B88B5CD660DF48A133.description: In appreciation prepare a letter, note, card or other communication for the work placement employer.

33D7869D117B43A5970EA0386DF79EAE.description: Update personal career documentation (e.g., resume, portfolio) following the work placement.

FDD378371F31414C921B1F2A6A3681DA.description: Reflect on the attainment of personal and learning goals.

3DBFD497D40144B18CBCCFF433147878.description: Showcase one’s skills and abilities demonstrated during the work placement using artifacts, evidence of skill development and personal reflections on aspects of the work experience such as: hours worked; responsibilities and tasks performed; the importance of attitude towards work and taking responsibility for what needs to be done; details about the entry level wage, salary scales and earning potential; worker rights and responsibilities and the role of the union, if applicable; ownership structure (e.g., corporation, franchise, sole proprietorship, partnership); and, opportunities for advancement at the workplace and elsewhere in the industry.

4F2EA3BE79F84BDAA26B320A5FE3CAE8.description: Relate one’s work placement experience to personal and career goals.

0F4B2CDC85F54729845623E641BD6769.description: Document knowledge and awareness of labour standards, safety, workplace ethics, rights and responsibilities, occupational health and safety, and networking observed during the work placement.

B1F7405304AE42A083EC440F1BF313C0.description: Document one’s experience using electronic and other tools (e.g., vlogs, blogs, log sheets, reflective journals) to summarize and reflect upon items such as: hours of work including breaks; responsibilities and tasks performed; interactions with the employer, staff, customers and others; company or organization’s ‘raison d’être;’ and, skills developed and demonstrated during the work placement that enhance one’s employability.

0743A951B3F9446E8051CE272668C387.description: Apply relevant skills and abilities during the work placement experience.

8D264E5D3CDF4614849C70B3D2C3ED25.description: Participate in a work placement experience.

EC4447B10D6A42E291F85A8006E0B25A.description: Reflect upon one’s performance during the interview.

0BAE9D1C30044638A18285C049D28715.description: Participate in an interview with the employer prior to beginning the work placement.

FD6A434B49BE415DAC555F9EF49E6C71.description: Develop a list of questions that could potentially be asked by the employer/work placement in an interview situation as well as answers to the questions.

D623C2C000F945B7B92AB281BCAFCD25.description: Brainstorm a list of questions to ask the employer before beginning the work placement; these may include: What is my schedule of work hours?, Who is my supervisor?, What should I wear?, When will I be provided with safety training?, What potential hazards might I encounter in the work placement?, Where do I find fire extinguishers, first aid kits and emergency assistance?, What type of safety gear am I expected to wear? Is it provided?, What should I do if I get injured or have an accident in the workplace?, How can I contact my health and safety committee or representative?, Are there any health and safety procedures I should follow?, Who is the first aid person?, Where are safety notices posted?, What should I do in case of a fire or emergency?

EFFBF9D48B7A412FAB053EB5D4CAF474.description: Compile an employer information package that includes documents needed for the work placement (e.g., personal career documentation such as a resume or portfolio, permission forms, logs, self- and employer evaluation forms).

12267AF7BD85473E8714FCF16DCE3525.description: Develop a procedural guide for the work placement that includes items such as: transportation to and from the work placement; hours of work; guidelines for absence and tardiness; dress code; job description; and, conflict resolution.

BB85232D780A4B2D88EF428FEE8A4AD0.description: In collaboration with all partners, develop personal and learning goals for the work placement.

97A12B72CC2C4F21B14D4208D316655D.description: Research the business/organization to become familiar with its operations.

3D4560E7798A4D30AF5241CB68C453C1.description: Explain the roles and responsibilities of each partner (e.g., student, parent, teacher or other school staff, employer) involved in the work placement.

DC2656F2E0154761B2BDCE255D8AA6B4.description: Maintain a clean and organized work area when performing automotive diagnosis and repair.

4734FE0FDD1D4B6B9C22D7FCD88F702C.description: Identify and demonstrate appropriate safety procedures when performing automotive diagnosis and repair.

B3D9A7FF659F4D93986F313FF197477B.description: Prepare a work order that summarizes the diagnostic process.

64693CC1E2CC4134AD9B7FFFEC53CF7B.description: Propose an approximate time frame for the diagnostic process.

2884D5816590480EB427970133638F0A.description: Identify required components, and compile a parts list and cost estimate for a repair or modification process.

D072816749A244248E336FB447013AFC.description: Follow appropriate processes to complete installations or modifications.

2ADF82A4097A4FE3AB3B89D726C73E2B.description: Use appropriate service information to identify proper repair processes.

D038843B2118417F842C7B6765C6D6A2.description: Follow logical diagnostic processes to identify, diagnose, repair and confirm the repair.

A2D13ACBBDEC4184AAE2BFD7920FBAC0.description: Perform advanced automotive and mechanical repairs, installations, and/or modifications.

12879121DC0B42818710892047A7E02A.description: Diagnose and perform differential service and repairs, such as changing fluid, removing and replacing differentials, overhauling and inspecting.

3BA313F8D3A3460C8B6488082C8CF81F.description: Explain the function and operation (e.g., power flow, differentiation and limited slip) of differentials.

FA4FEB46631F452B91E6C098B8101796.description: Identify and follow safe work practices (e.g., lift and support components properly and be aware of component weight and pinch points) when working with differentials, including maintaining a clean and organized work area.

EC93CBE501E140E88B685E87EFEF13E6.description: Diagnose and perform transfer case repairs, such as changing fluid, removing and replacing transfer case and adjusting shifting mechanisms.

79B3C47D0B2F42FBBB52D154C085CAC3.description: Explain how improper towing can damage transfer cases.

83B40F1973D54A76A5AB2B34AE4E44A3.description: Describe the function and operation of transfer cases.

CE527F48825747EEB3E87A3B8522D87D.description: Identify and follow safe work practices (e.g., lift and support components properly and be aware of component weight and pinch points) when working with transfer cases, including maintaining a clean and organized work area.

2F631F38D8B2463582F24E6B46866520.description: Diagnose, service and repair transfer cases.

9F05294E24DB4D8988CB804EB5354FEF.description: Diagnose and perform clutch and release mechanism repairs (e.g., clutch disc, pressure plate, flywheel, release mechanism, adjustments and alignment).

E5D9808568A74B55B1A9E76194515E30.description: Perform common clutch and release mechanism scheduled maintenance such as adjusting cables and linkages.

AE84B9A48BAA4ABCB97D96E4135CB7EC.description: Identify common symptoms and faults associated with clutches.

D7C87BACEAE94B51B1C4E2C0FA85D7B9.description: Explain the implications of slippage and excessive free play in a clutch.

CF09F22A52D9471887391A89FA7AAA80.description: Describe the construction and operation of clutch assemblies, including clutch fork and release bearing mechanisms.

2DE302FF857F4A05B30032DD677B7319.description: Explain the purpose and function of clutch assemblies.

25CD4109BE52426A94771E5E0754509A.description: Identify and follow safe work practices (e.g., be aware of asbestos dust from clutch components, avoid dust inhalation, avoid having pressurized hydraulic fluids pierce the skin or enter the bloodstream and be aware of component weight) when working with clutches and release mechanisms, including maintaining a clean and organized work area.

575EE2AB5DF447A1BC1CF5CE4164DA97.description: Diagnose, service and repair clutches and release mechanisms.

3DA72BC5675E48FBA9EFD21F4FE1C6B5.description: Perform common repairs on driveline components such as universal joints, CV shaft/boot and center bearing.

1A8C4EB9C310400CAA38C1FFF1718A18.description: Identify repair options for common driveline failures.

1D87E216DACB4559A0282C85BF950A69.description: Identify and inspect drivelines for common causes of failure such as vibration, incorrect running angle and play.

334019B2D2A941AE8FA0A84D528827D6.description: Describe the construction and operation of driveline components such as universal joints, constant velocity (CV) joints and drive shafts.

27FC4A322EB54B0CB8686D2D35A318A5.description: Explain the purpose, function and common configurations of automotive drivelines.

A383AB3C77E74A1C8EB33C9871F7B795.description: Identify and follow safe work practices (e.g., be aware of component weight and pinch points) when working with automotive drivelines, including maintaining a clean and organized work area.

AE777FB3FB794E928B5B1CAE0445A1FB.description: Diagnose, service and repair drive shafts and universal joints.

1BB8496B5FCB4A728A60564579F0A3A2.description: Perform proper engine start-up and run-in procedures.

9314048BFD7E4F65A115AF02892480A5.description: Verify that all components are properly installed and configured.

70A03FAD3FA248A785D1372185E6ABE9.description: Tighten fasteners using correct specifications and sequences.

3717C5590A7F475194AAEBD27350065F.description: Inspect and clean engine internal systems.

CACC2B29AD4F45F19C004F6F57D32549.description: Remove and replace gaskets, seals and O-rings.

F3352ABC48B24489BB6DD954A1CB217E.description: Identify types of specialized measuring equipment and use appropriate procedures to measure and evaluate engine condition (e.g., clearance, taper and out of round).

D5589F4E66E8427B818E2A4635822A6E.description: Follow appropriate procedures to disassemble and reassemble multicylinder engines.

8EAF35AECFF64647B20734104AC7F1E1.description: Discuss typical steps involved in overhauling multi-cylinder engines.

E126CC9069ED4712B8DB617A346069AA.description: Identify and follow safe work practices (e.g., be aware of pinch points, hot surfaces, sharp surfaces, moving parts, cleaning agents and fire hazards) when working with multi-cylinder engines, including maintaining a clean and organized work area.

7625A964BBC941FCA05A8B8DEFCFCBB8.description: Overhaul multicylinder engines safely and following correct procedures.

50F16F61035D4A62A27494EE088F446C.description: Lift and lower vehicles on a hoist in a safe manner using proper procedures.

FB2ADB864B694F5886B7BE3C13F42916.description: Raise large drivetrain assemblies using hoists and transmission jacks.

3B9A1F1424C446A1882F3CBBF46F1119.description: Lift and lower vehicles in a safe manner using floor jacks and jack stands.

F224D5EB07984693805DEB37D62684D8.description: Position vehicles safely and correctly before lifting.

8AF793F6824D443CB76D129C4FE2CE97.description: Identify lift and balance points for different types of vehicles.

454821168CD0432B8EDC75A2FA68CE68.description: Identify appropriate lifting and support equipment needed for the task.

6AD57617EE4B4B16A0D093CDBD13C4A7.description: Identify and follow appropriate safe practices related to lifting and supporting vehicles, including maintaining a clean and organized work area.

25D8C0156EDF4BBFAE0F2F92F4671229.description: Demonstrate safe procedures to lift and support vehicles.

512178EDC8C64F1DB13386BE12383D0E.description: Recognize and apply safe and fair work practices, including freedom from violence, harassment and bullying.

F53A1A7EB1A44F798A1E3402997EDC5F.description: Identify, label, store and handle hazardous materials according to Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System (WHMIS 2015).

D73F9EB2C49E4C7D9055F96DB13FEA2F.description: Locate, identify and explain the correct use of safety equipment (e.g., eye wash station and first aid station) in the workplace.

E0CBFFA7AE364B9B8F0B49B95A7B473F.description: Describe the importance of a clean workplace and methods used to maintain a clean workplace.

6D2763BD1DA445FB90C24E2D6BD6E26E.description: Identify the correct fire extinguisher for different classifications (i.e., A, B, C, D and K) of fires and how to use the extinguisher correctly (i.e., PASS - Pull Aim Squeeze Sweep).

20F1DF2DC88446D6AAA277A558953879.description: Identify potential health concerns when PPE is not used properly.

2D3A427EFD9C4503B8FF6A4CFD96C220.description: Identify industry standard personal protective equipment (PPE), such as safety goggles, hearing protection, gloves and footwear, and appropriate PPE cleaning procedures.

C625CB28F2E64FC69FC1A19583B2F00A.description: Inspect and utilize protective devices on equipment.

5F87A2E2A3674302A24573A4076108B9.description: Describe ways to reduce personal injury or material and equipment damage as a result of unsafe work acts or environments.

48586AAC117F4F20851D0D8DC1B49108.description: Identify the importance of safety when undertaking automotive service procedures, including safety hazards and preventative measures common to the automotive industry.

D1652258D3A0416EA92E40E7545C4FE4.description: Apply principles and techniques for injury prevention to ensure safety in the automotive workplace.

7ED69A2EA6314342A61D491FB5BEC5E6.description: Automotive Safety Equipment, Hazardous Materials, and Housekeeping Skills (Core)
